programme.title: Paul O'Grady's Little Heroes
programme.desc: Paul hears the story of six-year-old Noah, who was born with a genetic disorder that affects the body's organs and has been referred to Great Ormond Street for the removal of his kidney, which stopped working a long time ago. The presenter also meets a couple of two-year-olds - Lucas who has a detached retina and needs laser surgery on his eye and Taylor-Rose who has accidentally swallowed a watch battery

programme.title: Love Your Garden
programme.desc: Alan Titchmarsh creates an accessible garden in Derbyshire for Jack Parrott, a D-Day veteran approaching his 100th birthday. The team seeks out advice on clever new ways to create raised beds and patio-size greenhouses to find ways of allowing Jack to once again indulge in his life-long love of gardening

programme.title: Cooking with the Stars
programme.desc: Peter Andre, Jason Watkins and Indiyah Polack take to the kitchen, accompanied by their mentors, as they attempt to create the perfect British dish and avoid elimination in the Cook Off. Presented by Emma Willis and Tom Allen

programme.title: ITV News at Ten
programme.desc: A fresh perspective on the major stories of the day, featuring national and international news, with reports and analysis from ITV's correspondents

programme.title: ITV News London
programme.desc: Headlines affecting the local area

programme.title: The Hajj: A Journey Through Mecca
programme.desc: Shehab Khan observes the ritual of the Hajj pilgrimage to Mecca in Saudi Arabia, as around two million Muslims from around the globe attend the six-day event. Sharing personal experiences and reflections, Shehab explores the historical context of the journey and its origins, joining pilgrims as they circle the Kaaba seven times, walk between mountains, pray together and throw stones at 'Satan' - before sleeping under open sky in the desert

programme.title: Murder in the Family
programme.desc: One week into Covid lockdown, builder Rob murdered his wife Kelly and their two children, before turning the gun on himself. They had been seemingly happily married for 15 years. Elsewhere, supposedly mild-mannered Andrew Hooper stalked and shot his ex-wife Cheryl just inches away from her 14-year-old daughter. The first of this victim-led documentary series revisits events leading to the murders

programme.title: Tour de France Highlights
programme.desc: Action from stage 16, which consisted of a 22.4km individual time-trial from Passy to Combloux. Gary Imlach presents, with analysis from Peter Kennaugh and Ellen van Dijk, reports by Daniel Friebe and Matthew Rendell, and commentary from Ned Boulting and David Millar

programme.title: Catchphrase
programme.desc: Stephen Mulhern hosts the game show, asking three contestants to 'see it and say it' as they try to guess the familiar phrases hidden in animated clues. After the first elimination, the two remaining players battle to reach the Super Catchphrase round, where one of them could win 50,000

programme.title: Winning Combination
programme.desc: Omid Djalili host the quiz in which nine contestants are each assigned a number between one and nine, with the four that make the final trying to win the jackpot defined by those numbers. Each player's number is also the total of questions they must answer correctly in the final game against the clock

programme.title: The Switch
programme.desc: Quiz hosted by Sanjeev Bhaskar in which players four contestants can accumulate big cash totals by answering questions in a series of rounds that alternate between easy and hard, before one gets to the final stage and the chance to double the prize pot

programme.title: A Year on Planet Earth
programme.desc: Stephen Fry examines the impact that Spring has upon the natural world, a season which sees new life erupting across the Northern hemisphere as temperatures begin to rise. Further south in Kenya, a cheetah mother struggles to bring up her young in the wet season, and in Trinidad, turtle hatchlings begin their instinctive march towards the sea

programme.title: Lingo
programme.desc: Adil Ray hosts as three pairs of contestants call upon their powers of deduction in a battle of words, with the last remaining duo given the chance to double their winnings or leave with nothing. Playing today are partners Darren and Emma, father and daughter Neil and Bex, and engaged couple Norah and Dom

programme.title: Tipping Point
programme.desc: Ben Shephard hosts the quiz in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the greater the prize fund. The player who has won the least amount is then eliminated, and the last one standing competes for a 10,000 jackpot

programme.title: The Chase
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh presents as Dominic, Pepe, Luke and Clare pit their wits against one of the ruthless Chasers in the hope of winning a potential prize pot worth thousands of pounds. They work as a team and play strategically to answer general knowledge questions against the clock and race down the game board to the exit without being caught

programme.title: ITV News London
programme.desc: Headlines affecting the local area

programme.title: ITV Evening News
programme.desc: A round-up of the day's news headlines and talking points from the UK and around the world

programme.title: Emmerdale
programme.desc: Mary is torn, Caleb makes Tracy an offer, and Wendy is alarmed when Bob nearly catches her out

programme.title: Coronation Street
programme.desc: Elaine shares an alarming discovery about Stephen with a furious Tim, Isabella accuses Brian of conspiring to get rid of her, and Aadi's new job fails to live up to expectations

programme.title: Joanna Lumley's Spice Trail Adventure
programme.desc: The actress continues her journey on the African island of Madagascar, where she discovers the secrets of the world's second most expensive spice, vanilla. She also searches for gold with a poor gold-mining community, and finds out how cacao is used to make some of the world's best chocolate. Later, Joanna travels to the tourist island of Nosy Be, where the men participate in a dangerous martial art called Morengy and the women are paving the way for female equality

programme.title: ITV News at Ten
programme.desc: A fresh perspective on the major stories of the day, featuring national and international news, with reports and analysis from ITV's correspondents

programme.title: ITV News London
programme.desc: Headlines affecting the local area

programme.title: Peston
programme.desc: Political magazine show hosted by Robert Peston, featuring major interviews with MPs, topical guests and cultural figures. Including updates from social media taking in perspectives from viewers, experts and key players throughout the programme

programme.title: A Year on Planet Earth
programme.desc: Stephen Fry examines the impact that Spring has upon the natural world, a season which sees new life erupting across the Northern hemisphere as temperatures begin to rise. Further south in Kenya, a cheetah mother struggles to bring up her young in the wet season, and in Trinidad, turtle hatchlings begin their instinctive march towards the sea

programme.title: Tour de France Highlights
programme.desc: Action from stage 17, which consisted of a 166km route from Saint-Gervais Mont-Blanc to Courchevel. Gary Imlach presents, with analysis from Peter Kennaugh, reports by Daniel Friebe and Matthew Rendell, and commentary from Ned Boulting and David Millar

programme.title: Catchphrase
programme.desc: Nicola, Chris and Elysia compete to guess the phrases hidden in animated clues, but only one of them will go through to the Super Catchphrase round for the chance to win 50,000

programme.title: Winning Combination
programme.desc: Quiz, hosted by Omid Djalili, in which contestants Lance, Sophie, Elaine, Sean, Jake, Bridget, Nesta, Chidimma and Alex are assigned a number between one and nine. They are then whittled down to a final four, and the combination of numbers they are assigned represents the size of the jackpot they play to win in a final round

programme.title: Sport Filler Shows (2020)
programme.desc: Ed Chamberlin introduces some of the great racehorses of the modern era, including Nijinsky, Tiger Roll, Best Mate, Desert Orchid and Shergar

programme.title: Tonight
programme.desc: As a population we're living longer than ever before, but the years we're adding to our lives aren't necessarily the healthiest. In the UK, people are living on average 12 years in poor health - 14 per cent longer than in 1990. But what can we do to stop that? In the first of two programmes looking at healthy ageing, journalist Lara Lewington explores the lifestyle changes that might help us all live better for longer

programme.title: Next Level Chef
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay, Paul Ainsworth and Nyesha Arrington front this unique culinary challenge which sees a mixture of home cooks and professional chefs competing across a three-storey kitchen, ranging from the gloomy basement, which provides only basic ingredients, to the start-of-the-art top level. The ultimate winner will walk away with 100,000 and an unrivalled one-year mentorship from Gordon, Nyesha and Paul to help make their culinary dreams a reality. But who will climb their way to the top?

programme.title: Unwind with ITV
programme.desc: Daily escape designed to calm the mind and encourage relaxation and reflection

programme.title: Love Your Garden
programme.desc: Alan Titchmarsh creates an accessible garden in Derbyshire for Jack Parrott, a D-Day veteran approaching his 100th birthday. The team seeks out advice on clever new ways to create raised beds and patio-size greenhouses to find ways of allowing Jack to once again indulge in his life-long love of gardening

programme.title: Tonight
programme.desc: As a population we're living longer than ever before, but the years we're adding to our lives aren't necessarily the healthiest. In the UK, people are living on average 12 years in poor health - 14 per cent longer than in 1990. But what can we do to stop that? In the second of two Tonight programmes looking at healthy ageing, journalist Kate Quilton looks at the impact our diet can have on our later years

programme.title: Murder in the Family
programme.desc: Builder and father-of-two Kieran set fire to his mother-in-law in an ultimate act of hatred against his wife Susan. But what caused this horrendous spiral of violence, and what could have been done to avoid it? Using text messages, 999 call recordings, archive footage, and interviews with friends, family, the police and Susan herself, this film looks at the downward spiral of coercive control, domestic violence and drug abuse that led to a horrifying and tragic murder

programme.title: James Martin's French Adventure
programme.desc: The chef ends his excursion at the Bois de Boulogne, a park on the outskirts of Paris, coinciding with the hosting of a prestigious steeplechase event at its Auteuil Hippodrome. programme.title: Emmerdale
programme.desc: Rhona is heartbroken to see her mum so vulnerable. Bob motivates Tracy, and Laurel convinces Jai

programme.title: Paul O'Grady's Little Heroes
programme.desc: Paul hears the story of six-year-old Noah, who was born with a genetic disorder that affects the body's organs and has been referred to Great Ormond Street for the removal of his kidney, which stopped working a long time ago. The presenter also meets a couple of two-year-olds - Lucas who has a detached retina and needs laser surgery on his eye and Taylor-Rose who has accidentally swallowed a watch battery

programme.title: Love Your Garden
programme.desc: Alan Titchmarsh creates an accessible garden in Derbyshire for Jack Parrott, a D-Day veteran approaching his 100th birthday. programme.title: Cooking with the Stars
programme.desc: Peter Andre, Jason Watkins and Indiyah Polack take to the kitchen, accompanied by their mentors, as they attempt to create the perfect British dish and avoid elimination in the Cook Off. Presented by Emma Willis and Tom Allen

programme.title: ITV News at Ten
programme.desc: A fresh perspective on the major stories of the day, featuring national and international news, with reports and analysis from ITV's correspondents

programme.title: ITV News London
programme.desc: Headlines affecting the local area

programme.title: The Hajj: A Journey Through Mecca
programme.desc: Shehab Khan observes the ritual of the Hajj pilgrimage to Mecca in Saudi Arabia, as around two million Muslims from around the globe attend the six-day event. Sharing personal experiences and reflections, Shehab explores the historical context of the journey and its origins, joining pilgrims as they circle the Kaaba seven times, walk between mountains, pray together and throw stones at 'Satan' - before sleeping under open sky in the desert

programme.title: Murder in the Family
programme.desc: One week into Covid lockdown, builder Rob murdered his wife Kelly and their two children, before turning the gun on himself. They had been seemingly happily married for 15 years. Elsewhere, supposedly mild-mannered Andrew Hooper stalked and shot his ex-wife Cheryl just inches away from her 14-year-old daughter. The first of this victim-led documentary series revisits events leading to the murders

programme.title: Tour de France Highlights
programme.desc: Action from stage 16, which consisted of a 22.4km individual time-trial from Passy to Combloux. Gary Imlach presents, with analysis from Peter Kennaugh and Ellen van Dijk, reports by Daniel Friebe and Matthew Rendell, and commentary from Ned Boulting and David Millar

programme.desc: Stephen Mulhern hosts the game show, asking three contestants to 'see it and say it' as they try to guess the familiar phrases hidden in animated clues. Sarah Tansey and Duncan Bell star

programme.title: Vera
programme.desc: Crime drama starring Brenda Blethyn. The detective investigates a fire that rips through a holiday park on the Northumberland coast, destroying three cabins. A young woman's body is discovered and the resort's owner, Jim Viner, fears the victim is his sister Deena when he returns from a weekend away with his daughter Clare. With Jim's suspicions confirmed, a police report then reveals Clare's boyfriend Ryan and his friends had been partying near the scene hours before the blaze started, but where are they now, and where is Deena's best friend Sally? Co-starring Kenny Doughty, Cush Jumbo and Jon Morrison

programme.title: Law & Order: UK
programme.desc: A six-month-old boy dies in what appears to be a case of cot death, but when shaken baby syndrome is later revealed as the cause, Brooks and Devlin are left with a murder investigation that throws up many possible suspects. New evidence then comes to light during the trial, casting doubt over the prosecution's case, with Steel and Phillips forced into doing some detective work of their own. Bradley Walsh, Jamie Bamber and Ben Daniels star

programme.title: The Bay
programme.desc: As the Metcalf children struggle to come to terms with their loss, CCTV evidence leads to a major development in the case. Meanwhile, Karen and Jenn attempt to secure a new home for the Metcalf family when an unexpected arrival at a fundraising event causes old tensions to resurface. Starring Marsha Thomason and Andrew Dowbiggin

programme.title: The Royal
programme.desc: Adam is quick to question Dr Weatherill's competence when a beach outing ends tragically for a family. Dr Ormerod leaps in to defend her - but ends up revealing his colleague's condition in his haste. Meanwhile, Dr Goodwin struggles to help a pair of teenage parents gain access to their baby. Amy Robbins and Robert Daws star

programme.title: The Royal
programme.desc: Mr Rose and Dr Ormerod attempt to rescue a drowning boy during a trip to a hippie commune. Catherine is asked on a date by a local fisherman, while Dr Goodwin discovers the parents of a sick baby are not all they seem after he diagnoses the infant's illness. Robert Daws, Denis Lill, Amelia Curtis and Paul Fox star

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Poirot
programme.desc: The dapper Belgian sleuth goes on an Egyptian cruise on board an old steamer, but when an American heiress is murdered, his little grey cells go into overdrive. On questioning each of his fellow passengers, he realises many of them have secrets they want to remain hidden. David Suchet stars, with James Fox, Judy Parfitt, Emily Blunt, Daisy Donovan, Frances de la Tour and David Soul

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Dr Merrick is called out to a remote farmhouse, where she discovers three children have been left orphaned by the death of their father. Adamant that the family should stay together, Steve helps the eldest fight a custody battle, but a series of obstacles stands in their way. Meanwhile, Vernon opens a caravan park, but it is David who ends up having to entertain the not-so-happy campers

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Steve does his bit for the community by taking a group of delinquents on an outdoor adventure course on the moors, but one of the lads falls and breaks his ankle, while another is wanted for stealing from a shop. Vernon sees a money-making opportunity when a religious sect arrives in Aidensfield looking for somewhere to hold a meditation convention. Rural police drama, starring James Carlton and Geoffrey Hughes

programme.title: Vera
programme.desc: When the remains of a teenager are found half-buried in a wood, Vera finds herself investigating a 30-year-old mystery. Identified as Carrie Telling, a girl who disappeared during the 1984 miners' strike, the team retrieves news footage from the protests that shows her taking pictures in the background. It appears she got caught up in the unrest that day, contradicting her father's assertion that she went straight home. Photographs recovered from her camera yield further revelations for Vera. What did Carrie discover that ultimately led to her death?

programme.title: Law & Order: UK
programme.desc: A body is found with a note reading 'They Must Be Destroyed' - a chilling reminder of a case Brooks was involved in six years previously, when extreme racist Andrew Dillon killed three boys from ethnic minorities. Steel is then put under intense scrutiny when it is revealed that his success in convicting Dillon was largely due to selective prosecution. Bradley Walsh and Ben Daniels star

programme.title: The Bay
programme.desc: Dean is faced with another life-changing event, and unable to deal with his grief, he returns to work. With tensions running high, Jenn fears that he may resort to doing something he regrets. Gordon Ramsay heads to Easton, Pennsylvania, to help the troubled pair and save the business from financial disaster

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The competition starts at Gracelands Glamping, in Ballyronan, County Londonderry, where couple Shaun Coleman and Hollie Pattison host. In the evening, Derry and Mike's broken TV leaves the pair pining for some entertainment. At breakfast, the DIY instant barbecue gets a grilling by some of the guests, and the hosts find some of their scores hard to digest

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Former international rugby union player Brian Robinson welcomes guests to Manse on the Beach in Cloughey, Co Down, where sea views and an onsite sauna prove a hit

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The third visit of the week is to The Secret Garden Glamping in Skelmersdale, Lancashire, but guests feel hemmed in by their hideaway and yearn for a communal connection

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The final visit of the week is to Walkeringham in Nottinghamshire, and Hawthorn Hideaway, owned by partners Ronnie and Jo Lee. They're hoping that their relaxing, adults-only accommodation will be loved by all. Guests Derry and Mike are delighted by the dcor, and Shaun and Hollie are stunned by a surprise, but things don't quite add up for Brian. In the morning, the cook-your-own breakfast is a hit with most, but for Derry and Mike, the facilities failing leads to frustration

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: On the final day, the B&B owners gather to settle some scores. Gracelands Glamping is up first and Shaun and Hollie want to get to the bottom of their disappointing breakfast scores. Meanwhile, Brian wants to pull back the covers on Shaun and Hollie's sleep score from Manse on the Beach. Eventually, the payments are revealed and a winner is announced

programme.title: Countdown
programme.desc: Colin Murray and Rachel Riley host the long running words-and-numbers game with Radio 2 presenter Trevor Nelson joining wordsmith Susie Dent in Dictionary Corner

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Lee Juggurnauth jets off to the historic town of Mojcar in Spain's Almera region to help house-hunters Christine and Howard find the perfect holiday home. After 30 years of marriage and a few difficult years back at home, the couple have decided it's finally the right time to fulfil their long-held dream of buying a place in the sun. Lee sources five properties within their 50,000 budget

programme.title: Chateau DIY
programme.desc: It's an exciting day for Amy and Marc, as they get an award for their renovations and host a picnic in their garden for 60 of the organisation's members. However, the garden is criss-crossed by open trenches for all their ongoing plumbing and electrical work. Becky and Mark are under pressure to complete their final guest room, but they still find time to introduce their daughters to two new kittens. In north west France, Philip and Angelina are flat out preparing for the events season. The moat must be navigated to smarten up the chateau's enormous shutters and Angelina makes over a kilometre of bunting. Narrated by Adjoa Andoh

programme.title: Sun, Sea and Selling Houses
programme.desc: In Alicante, Sophie and Charlotte Rodriguez try to make holiday home dreams come true for retired NHS worker Julie from Swansea, whose perfect pad includes two bedrooms, outside space and room for her best friend to visit. It's up to the Rodriguez sisters to come up with the goods on a 105,000 euro budget. In Mlaga, Shani and Andrew Hamilton search for a Spanish home for husband and wife Mike and Eva. Eva grew up by the sea in Cornwall and is keen to add a swim in the sea to her morning routine, so a place close to the beach is a priority. She hopes her budget of 230,000 euros will secure this ambition

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Spoof behind-the-scenes special exploring what makes the dysfunctional family's antics so popular. Featuring the guest voices of Willie Nelson, Gary Coleman and Stephen Hawking

programme.title: Hollyoaks
programme.desc: John Paul is attacked as he leaves a club night at The Loft, Cindy wakes up in hospital and has to face reality, and Yazz and Tom feel a strain on their relationship

programme.title: Channel 4 News
programme.desc: Including sport and weather

programme.title: The Dog Academy
programme.desc: A new student enrols in the imposing form of a four-year-old newfador called Ruby. Eight-stone of solid dog, Ruby refuses to budge when owners Nichola and Zeal take her for a walk. However, trainers Sean and Kamal soon there's more to Ruby's stubbornness than meets the eye. Six-year-old Maltese Bichon cross Marco arrives with fed up owner Beth in tow. Beth inherited Marco from her late father - and Marco's repaying the favour by ignoring every word Beth says

programme.title: The Supervet
programme.desc: The work of a pioneering veterinary practice, where 'Bionic Vet' Noel Fitzpatrick and a team of more than 100 surgeons, nurses, ward attendants and physiotherapists help some of the nation's hardest-to-cure pets through cutting-edge treatment and operations. This series opens with a special episode featuring the amazing stories - old and new - of some of the youngest and cutest puppies for whom Noel has provided life-saving treatment since The Supervet began in 2014, and the families at the centre of their inspiring stories

programme.title: Rosie Jones: Am I a R*tard?
programme.desc: The comedian takes the opportunity to explore and educate viewers on the online abuse faced by those with disabilities, including herself as a person with cerebral palsy. She sets herself the challenge of confronting a troll directly, and explores the role that social media plays in the rise of this abuse. Rosie wants everyone in the UK to be made aware of ableism and to stand up to it when they see it and for everyone to play their part in ending the suffering of people who are abused simply because of their disability

programme.title: First Dates
programme.desc: Two divorcees go in search of a more successful match, and a woman who despairs of ever finding the right man finds her head turned from her date to another man in the restaurant. A barbershop owner tries to settle his nerves by drinking heavily before the date, and an unconventional neuroscientist looks for love with an artistic woman who has always put other people's needs first, but now wants something for herself

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: At Nottingham's Queen's Medical Centre, 87-year-old Joan is brought in after falling on a moving tram and cutting open the back of her head. Elsewhere, 19-year-old Rose faces life-changing injuries after being thrown into the air by a car, and 13-year-old Prince has broken his leg in three places playing football

programme.title: Becoming Elizabeth
programme.desc: Drama following the untold story of Elizabeth I, before she ascended the throne. Henry VIII's death throws a young orphan Elizabeth Tudor into the unpredictable and dangerous English court. As her nine-year-old brother is crowned king and the great families of England and powers of Europe vie for control of the country, she and her siblings become pawns in a dangerous game

programme.title: Miriam and Alan: Lost in Scotland and Beyond
programme.desc: Actors Miriam Margolyes and Alan Cumming take off on a motorhome adventure to rediscover their Scottish roots. They start out in Glasgow, visiting the street where Miriam's Jewish family first lived in Scotland, then journey north into the Highlands. Alan learns about his ancestral past at Cawdor Castle, they meet up with fellow actor Bill Paterson and stop off in Carnoustie, where things take a somber turn as Alan remembers his abusive childhood

programme.title: Extraordinary Escapes with Sandi Toksvig
programme.desc: Sandi is joined by comedian and author Rosie Jones for a journey round the Midlands exploring the best staycation retreats they have to offer. The pair begin in Rutland where they stay at the Rocket Lodge, an eco-build made of upcycled grain silos that boasts a wood-fired hot-tub, a circular kitchen and a disco bathroom. In the sand dunes on a strip of the Lincolnshire coastline, the duo stay in a rebooted 70s beach house called Sandy Feet where Sandi learns that 'Netflix and chill' doesn't mean what she thinks it does. They end their trip close to the Welsh border on the Walcot Estate in a 200-year-old hideaway known as the Wheelwright's shop that once lived 20 miles away but was dismantled and transported piece by piece before being rebuilt to look exactly the same

programme.title: Couples Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Three couples from Plymouth compete for the 1,000 cash prize. On the first night, beauty therapist Christine and fiance Kevin surprise their guests, while the second day sees young married couple Harvey and Natasha opt for a Spanish theme. Estate agent Paul and his wife Jo try to pull off an ambitious menu for the final meal of the week, but Paul must keep his nerves at bay as the pressure mounts

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp and Phil Spencer catch up with two pairs of house-hunters. Chris and Nicola from Hastings were newlyweds searching for their dream home nine years ago, while couple Trudi and Steve relocated from Edinburgh to North Yorkshire in order to be closer to family

programme.title: Undercover Boss USA
programme.desc: Bowlero is a global bowling company with thousands of employees and hundreds of centres. It became a bowling giant almost overnight when it took over AMF and Bowlmor Lanes. Colie Edison created every element of the Bowlero brand. Now she wants to go undercover to find out how the new Bowlero is working for staff and customers. As her alter ego Michelle, who recently lost her job as a court reporter and now wants to find a second career, Colie works as a trainee manager, a lane server, an event host and a trainee facilities manager

programme.desc: Gregg heads to Amsterdam, learning about its history and touring its art galleries and canals to find out why the Dutch capital became known as the most liberal place in Europe. Gregg also gets stuck into the food and returns to his market roots with a trip to Amsterdam's famous flower-trading floor, where over half the world's blooms pass through at some point

programme.title: 5 News Update
programme.desc: The latest reports

programme.title: Puzzling

programme.title: 5 News Update
programme.desc: The latest reports

programme.title: Surgeons: A Matter of Life or Death
programme.desc: Cameras follow life-saving operations at the University Hospitals Birmingham. The first episode features Stephen, 53, whose rapidly growing and aggressive mouth and jaw cancer is a cause for critical concern. Surgeons Prav Praveen and Sat Parmar need to urgently perform an extraordinary and radical procedure - removing and discarding Stephen's jaw, two thirds of his tongue and his bottom teeth, while rebuilding the jaw using bone from his leg and creating an entirely new tongue from his own flesh

programme.title: Cold Case Killers
programme.desc: The sadistic murder of Wendy Speakes in Wakefield, where evidence suggested that a man with a twisted fetish was on the loose and could kill again

programme.title: Police: Night Shift 999
programme.desc: The first call of the night for the Gloucestershire officers is to an RTC in the rural country lanes, where the driver has misjudged a corner and her car has landed on its roof. Meanwhile, a call comes through to control from a member of public about suspected snakes abandoned in pillowcases at the side of the road, and response officers spot a driver in town driving erratically

programme.title: Criminals: Caught on Camera
programme.desc: The inside track on all the techniques and technology being used to make our streets and lives safer

programme.title: Teleshopping

programme.desc: Part two of two. The stories of multimillionaire celebrity hair stylist Nicky Clarke, who unexpectedly found love with his PA Kelly Simpkin, and 72-year-old millionaire Lyn, who is accustomed to dating men 40 years her junior and is on the hunting for Mr Right

programme.title: OMG
programme.desc: Documentary about people who have undergone extreme cosmetic surgery to achieve their ideal appearance. The first episode focuses on three women who have tried to turn themselves into Barbie dolls, including a woman who has spent 11 years transforming herself and is now about to begin a new relationship

programme.title: Wildlife SOS
programme.desc: The work of volunteers treating sick, injured and orphaned animals at a wildlife sanctuary

programme.title: House Doctor
programme.desc: Property expert Ann Maurice tackles a Glasgow bachelor pad set in a sought-after stately home address in city-centre parkland, but the ancient Egyptian theme proves a sticking point

programme.title: Entertainment News on 5
programme.desc: Showbiz news and gossip

programme.title: Milkshake! Monkey's Amazing Adventures
programme.desc: Milkshake! Monkey meets Richard to find out how a canal lock help boats travel up and down hill

programme.title: Paw Patrol
programme.desc: News arrives of an incoming windstorm, but Marshall is being tested for his green belt by Sensei Yumi out in the woods and they cannot be contacted

programme.title: The Mouse That Roared (1959)
programme.desc: The leaders of the tiny European duchy of Grand Fenwick decide to solve their bankruptcy problem by declaring war on the USA. They confidently expect to lose and thereby qualify for economic aid - but the plan takes an unexpected turn for the worse when the Americans surrender. Comedy, starring Peter Sellers in three roles, with Jean Seberg, William Hartnell, David Kossoff and Leo McKern

programme.title: 3:10 to Yuma (1957)
programme.desc: A farmer in need of money agrees to guard a notorious outlaw until the train arrives to transport him to jail. Meanwhile, the pair are holed up in a hotel, where his prisoner plays mind games with him - and the villain's cohorts are waiting outside ready to engineer an escape. Western adapted from a novel by Elmore Leonard, with Van Heflin, Glenn Ford, Felicia Farr and Leora Dana

programme.title: Detective Story (1951)
programme.desc: A moralistic New York cop is determined to ensure the conviction of an illegal abortionist implicated in the deaths of several women. However, his obsession leads him to lose control, and he is disturbed to discover his own wife was once one of the doctor's patients - a secret she had kept from him. Police drama, starring Kirk Douglas, Eleanor Parker and William Bendix

programme.title: Arizona Raiders (1965)
programme.desc: In the aftermath of the American Civil War, two Confederate soldiers are offered a way out of jail. Their former comrades-in-arms are now a gang of bandits terrorising Arizona, and the two prisoners are sent to infiltrate the group and bring them to justice. Western, starring Audie Murphy, Buster Crabbe, Ben Cooper and Gloria Talbott

programme.title: Gods of Egypt (2016)
programme.desc: An ancient Egyptian god is driven into exile when his evil brother murders their father and seizes his throne. He enlists the aid of a human thief in restoring justice, and in return offers to help the mortal to bring his murdered lover back to life. Fantasy adventure, starring Nikolaj Coster-Waldau, Brenton Thwaites, Gerard Butler and Chadwick Boseman

programme.title: John Wick: Chapter 3 - Parabellum (2019)
programme.desc: The seemingly invincible hero returns, this time with a $14million bounty on his head which rises each hour, and every underworld figure around the world desperate to cash in. However, John Wick does receive support from Sofia, a fellow dog lover, assassin and manager of Casablanca's Continental Hotel. Director Chad Stahelski's action thriller sequel, starring Keanu Reeves, Halle Berry and Ian McShane

programme.title: Mission: Impossible - Dead Reckoning Part 1 Interview Special
programme.desc: Tom Cruise, Hayley Atwell, Simon Pegg and director Christopher McQuarrie talk about the spectacular seventh film in the action-adventure series

programme.title: The Hunt (2019)
programme.desc: A group of elites gather for the first time at a remote manor house to hunt ordinary Americans for sport. However, the elites' master plan is about to be derailed because one of the hunted, Crystal, knows the hunters' game better than they do, and turns the tables on the killers as she makes her way toward the mysterious woman at the centre of the mystery. Director Craig Zobel's horror thriller, starring Betty Gilpin, Hilary Swank and Emma Roberts

programme.title: The Exorcism of Emily Rose (2005)
programme.desc: A student dies after an attempted exorcism by a priest who was convinced she was possessed by evil spirits. A sceptical lawyer is assigned to defend the cleric against the charge of manslaughter, but as the case unfolds she finds her own convictions challenged. Horror drama, starring Tom Wilkinson, Laura Linney, Jennifer Carpenter, Campbell Scott and Colm Feore

programme.title: The Duel at Silver Creek (1952)
programme.desc: A gambler goes after the gang of claim jumpers who killed his father, and joins forces with an injured marshal who also wants the criminals brought to justice. However, their partnership is tested when a devious femme fatale enters their lives. Don Siegel's Western, starring Audie Murphy, Stephen McNally and Faith Domergue

programme.title: Timberjack (1954)
programme.desc: A man forced to return to his Montana home to take over the family lumber business sets out to discover the reasons behind his father's death, while engaging in a fierce professional and romantic rivalry with a neighbouring forester. Western, starring Sterling Hayden, David Brian, Vera Ralston and Hoagy Carmichael

programme.title: Footsteps in the Fog (1955)
programme.desc: A prominent Victorian gentleman thinks he has got away with poisoning his wife, but his shrewd maid knows the sordid truth and uses it to blackmail him. As the killer's social standing improves, he realises he has to get rid of the scheming servant once and for all, but his plans to dispose of her lead him into even more danger. Period thriller, with Stewart Granger, Jean Simmons and Bill Travers

programme.title: Journey to the Center of the Earth (1959)
programme.desc: An explorer discovers a prehistoric monster-infested world deep beneath Earth's crust and faces a tough ordeal escaping the predatory attacks of the creatures as he tries to guide his team back to safety. Sci-fi adventure based on Jules Verne's novel, starring Pat Boone, James Mason, Arlene Dahl and Diane Baker

programme.title: Turner & Hooch (1989)
programme.desc: A Californian detective investigating the murder of a local man by drug smugglers has only one witness to help him solve the case - the large, smelly dog that belonged to the victim, which is about to turn the detective's well-ordered existence into chaos. Family comedy, starring Tom Hanks, Mare Winningham and Craig T Nelson

programme.title: The Departed (2006)
programme.desc: A cop infiltrates the inner circle of a feared Boston mobster, unaware a fellow officer is already an informant on the gangster's payroll. When both the crooks and the police discover they have a mole in their ranks, the two detectives realise they are in sudden danger and try to expose each other. Martin Scorsese's Oscar-winning thriller, starring Leonardo DiCaprio, Matt Damon, Jack Nicholson, Mark Wahlberg, Martin Sheen and Alec Baldwin

programme.title: The Lighthouse (2019)
programme.desc: In the late 19th century, Ephraim Winslow is hired to work for a month on an isolated island off the coast of New England, under the supervision of an irritable old man named Thomas Wake. Winslow tries to stay sane as Wake assigns him a series of arduous tasks, but that seems to be the toughest job of all. Co-writer/director Robert Eggers' psychological thriller, starring Robert Pattinson and Willem Dafoe

programme.title: The Autopsy of Jane Doe (2016)
programme.desc: Father and son coroners are drawn into a complex mystery while attempting to identify a young dead woman, who was apparently hiding dark secrets. Thriller, starring Brian Cox, Emile Hirsch and Ophelia Lovibond

programme.title: The Green Man (1956)
programme.desc: A professional assassin and master of disguise is assigned to murder a pompous politician - only to find his efforts hampered by a bumbling vacuum cleaner salesman. Black comedy, starring Alastair Sim, George Cole, Jill Adams and Terry-Thomas

programme.title: The Bridge on the River Kwai (1957)
programme.desc: A British colonel in a Japanese PoW camp is ordered to build a railway bridge over a river, forging a vital communications link. At first he refuses to obey, but eventually agrees to take the project on - and becomes so obsessed with the task that he creates a dilemma for an American soldier sent to destroy the structure. David Lean's Oscar-winning Second World War drama, starring Alec Guinness, William Holden and Jack Hawkins

programme.title: Annie (1982)
programme.desc: An orphan wins the fatherly affections of a tough-talking billionaire - but the no-good owner of the orphanage and her brother are out to ruin the girl's chances of happiness and make a quick profit in the process. Musical, directed by John Huston, based on the stage play. Starring Aileen Quinn, Albert Finney, Carol Burnett and Tim Curry

programme.title: Instant Family (2018)
programme.desc: After being taunted by relatives who think they will never have kids, married couple Pete and Ellie Wagner consider the option of adopting a child. However, they get more than they bargained for when they take in a rebellious teen and her two siblings. Director Sean Anders' comedy, starring Mark Wahlberg, Rose Byrne and Isabela Merced

programme.title: Arrival (2016)
programme.desc: The world is thrown into uproar when 12 alien spaceships arrive at locations around the globe. As tensions rise between nations and fear of the arrivals grows, a recently bereaved linguist is recruited by the US army to find a way to communicate with the aliens and discover why they have come. Sci-fi drama, starring Amy Adams, Jeremy Renner and Forest Whitaker

programme.title: Collateral (2004)
programme.desc: A Los Angeles taxi driver picks up a sharp-suited fare and is shocked when a dead body almost plunges through his windscreen during the first stop on the journey. The enigmatic passenger then reveals he is a hitman with four more contracts to carry out before the night is over, and forces the driver to help him. Michael Mann's thriller, starring Tom Cruise and Jamie Foxx

programme.title: Caught in Time (2020)
programme.desc: A detective tracks down a gang of criminals a decade after they initially evaded arrest. Lau Ho Leung's action crime thriller, starring Daniel Wu and Qianyuan Wang. In Mandarin with English subtitles

programme.title: Hollyoaks
programme.desc: Mercedes is determined to make sure everyone is aware of the injuries that she thinks Warren has inflicted on Felix, while the McQueens discover that Freya is back

programme.title: Heir Hunters

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The competition kicks off in rural Co Durham at Bowlees Farm Holiday Cottages, where married couple Tony and Viv Smith hope that their tranquil setting, private hot tubs and indoor swimming pool will leave their guests feeling as though they've died and gone to Durham. At first, their guests are bowled over by the views and the facilities but on closer inspection, friends Jane and Rachel find fault with the cleanliness in the kitchen. At dinner, it's revealed that breakfast will be provided by the local farm shop a mile down the road, the only facility that Tony and Viv don't seem to have. Despite the clean plates, married couple Amanda and Howard make their feelings clear on the lack of options. programme.title: Four in a Bed

programme.title: The Secret Life of the Zoo

Meanwhile, rhino couple Beni and Asha are experiencing family dysfunction, and when Asha ignores Beni, he is left to find solace in the company of a deer. Elsewhere, The zoo's new thousand-strong family of leaf cutter ants work together to build a new home for themselves out of their Christmas bounty

programme.title: The Dog House

programme.title: Grand Designs

The end-of-terrace plot is on a hill and surrounded by woodland within a strict conservation area, so it won't be an easy build. But having come through a divorce and cancer treatment, Corinne sees the house as vital on so many levels, not least as an opportunity to create a space that represents her new lease of life

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E

programme.title: D-Day: The King Who Fooled Hitler

The programme also examines how the Queen Mother preserved one of the greatest secrets of the Second World War

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: The documentary following life inside an A&E department returns. Emergency care nurse Tim reflects on his role and describes the impact his GP father had on his life. Meanwhile, Pam, who has Alzheimer's, is brought in with suspected sepsis. The 82-year-old's daughter Lisa paints a picture of Pam in her early years as a lively, fun-loving woman managing a West End club. Emergency nurse practitioner Maria treats 27-year old Theo, who hurt his knee playing football

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: Doctors treat 75-year-old Bipin, who has been rushed to A&E suffering a stroke. Emergency nurse practitioner Louise, who has been nursing for nearly 40 years, shares how the tough times she's experienced in her life enable her to have more empathy with her patients. programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Communications director Kath and graphic designer Charlotte from east London cannot wait to escape their busy city lives by buying a Spanish holiday home around the stunning mountains of the Sierra Nevada, where it's possible to sunbathe on the beach and go skiing, all in the same day. Danni Menzies finds five options for their 120,000 budget, but will any wow them enough to want to put in an offer?

programme.title: A New Life in the Sun
programme.desc: In Spain, a bike tour business gets ready for 50 Belgians. A flat tyre adds to a family's woes in Portugal, while cameras encounter a couple who are swapping one new life in the sun for another

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programme.desc: The team is near Preston, where Simon O'Brien restores a spotlight he believes may be from a German U-boat while Henry Cole gets creative with an aircraft jump seat

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programme.desc: Henry Cole and Simon O'Brien visit Hay-on-Wye and Bedford. Henry lovingly restores a bespoke workbench and Simon ponders the possibilities of some discarded planks of wood

programme.title: Heir Hunters
programme.desc: The story of a family divided by agricultural hardship who ended up living on opposite sides of the world, and as the team races to find the heirs to a recently advertised unclaimed estate, a surprise connection is made in Malta

programme.title: Heir Hunters
programme.desc: The probate researchers try to solve the tricky case of a man named Smith. Plus, the story of a man whose troubled childhood led him to become separated from his adoptive family, and details of more unclaimed estates

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The first visit of the week comes from Jockhedge Holiday Cottages in Burgh le Marsh, Lincolnshire, where owner Karen Cumberlidge and her son Liam hope to wow their guests

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The second visit of the week is to the Victoria Inn in Witton-le-Wear, County Durham, where someone gets locked in a bathroom and bed springs leave one couple facing a battle

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: For the third visit of the week, husband and wife Aidan and Mij Nattrass welcome their rivals to the Earlston House Hotel in Paignton, Devon

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The final visit is to the Beach House in Portland, Dorset, where Pete Lacey feels his back-to-basics approach offers his guests good value. But things get heated with the radiator in Karen and Liam's room and opinions are laid bare over dinner

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The B&B owners meet for the last time to find out how much they've been paid and to settle some scores. Karen and Liam are shocked by their payment from Pete, while Carolynne and George want to find out what caused Karen and Liam to lose sleep at their place

programme.title: The Secret Life of the Zoo
programme.desc: Golden poison frog Pablo has lost interest in his partner Maria, so 'bad boy' El Loco is brought in to shake things up. In the chimpanzee habitat, there is a power struggle for the role of dominant female, and baby porcupine Marion fends off the meerkat mob

programme.title: The Dog House
programme.desc: Olympic cyclist Victoria Pendleton visits Woodgreen animal charity, keen to find a dog she can co-parent with her mother. She meets Leilo, but the Rhodesian ridgeback's long-term medical needs require serious consideration. Lovebirds Shai and Orin's try to hit it off with Polo the lurcher, while Zoe the beagle meets the Forristal family

programme.title: Grand Designs
programme.desc: Kevin McCloud follows the progress of a dual-purpose family and wheelchair-friendly home built by design engineer and former Paralympic swimmer Mark Butler. Mark was paralysed from the waist down following a motorcycle accident and the home he currently lives in with his family makes it virtually impossible for him to complete even the simplest of tasks around the house. He and his wife Penny want to build a cutting-edge family home, with a drive-in basement, passenger lift and accessible kitchen and bathroom. However, building such a unique property proves a huge challenge, and the strain on Mark and Penny becomes almost unbearable

programme.title: The Great British Dig: History in Your Back Garden
programme.desc: Hugh Dennis and the expert archaeologists revisit some of their most exciting archaeological adventures - from incredible Roman revelations to the unveiling of Viking faces from the past. Armed with trusty trowels and spades of enthusiasm, Hugh and the team have been digging in back gardens across the country for the past few years, all in a quest to uncover new chapters of history. With help from local communities, they reveal the secrets beneath the nation's feet

programme.title: Ancient Secrets of Althorp with Charles Spencer
programme.desc: Documentary following the 9th Earl of Spencer, who has always been fascinated by rumours of a lost Anglo Saxon village believed to have been located in the grounds of his ancestral home. He organises an archaeological dig to search for evidence, and while few traces of the sought-after settlement emerge, something far older comes to light - a Neolithic encampment which experts believe is more than 5000 years old

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: A patient with a rare condition is rushed in to St George's in south west London, struggling to breathe. Her husband tells the story of their child's struggle with leukemia. A woman with a history of emphysema comes to St George's after complaining to her GP of chest pains, and a 19-year-old medical student has an abnormal growth on her femur

programme.title: Emergency Helicopter Medics
programme.desc: In Co Durham, heli-medics battle to keep Mick alive after he has a seizure. A fun day takes a turn at the motocross track that leaves 12-year-old Ollie with a limb-threatening injury. And in the Yorkshire Dales, there's a dramatic hillside rescue for seriously-injured paraglider Alastair

programme.title: 999: On the Front Line
programme.desc: Paramedics rush to save a grandmother with severe osteoporosis who fell down the stairs carrying her four-month-old grandson. In Stratford, paramedics Mandy Morrice and Michelle Godwin treat a racegoer on a night out who collapsed in the street and suffered a serious head wound. In Warwick, a concerned member of the public calls emergency services to a suspected cardiac arrest but ends up becoming the patient himself. Plus, Neil Vann and Laura Perkins give life-saving treatment to an elderly man found unconscious face down in his hallway

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: A patient with a rare condition is rushed in to St George's in south west London, struggling to breathe. Her husband tells the story of their child's struggle with leukemia. A woman with a history of emphysema comes to St George's after complaining to her GP of chest pains, and a 19-year-old medical student has an abnormal growth on her femur

programme.title: Food Unwrapped
programme.desc: Another selection of the team's favourite investigations, including Kate Quilton's visit to McVitie's in Carlisle to find out why so many biscuits have little holes all over them. Jimmy Doherty heads to Portugal to see how corks are made for wine bottles, while Matt Tebbutt is in Italy to learn why mascarpone is more expensive than other soft cheeses

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home

programme.title: Lazy Boy Garage
programme.desc: The boys find a mint condition Seat 133 in Spain, fitting in with their quest to capture the spirit of retro motorsport, but will they be able to find the right buyer?

programme.title: Lazy Boy Garage
programme.desc: The boys are on the hunt for a car that screams the 1980s and find what they're looking for with a two-door VW Jetta, but Tim opens a can of worms when he removes the headlining

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson and James May ask whether the Eastern Bloc countries ever made a good car, and Richard Hammond assesses the performance of German sports model the Veritas. The Ford Fiesta is also put through its paces in a stringent road test, and Mayor of London Boris Johnson is the Star in a Reasonably Priced Car

programme.title: Border Force: America's Gatekeepers
programme.desc: More than 100 boxes full of drugs are discovered inside an unlikely vehicle at the World Trade Bridge. In Progreso, a suspected gang member attempts to cross into the United States

programme.title: Railroad Australia
programme.desc: Cracks appear in a multi-billion-dollar iron ore railroad. Plus, learner driver James must survive the punishing Cockatoo run and the ire of instructor Dave Boyd

programme.title: Gino's Italian Escape
programme.desc: Gino D'Acampo visits a traditional farm in Puglia to take a look at the olive trees that produce Italy's famous oil, and the visit inspires the chef to rustle up carpaccio of beef with his own spin on a gremolata dressing. He then heads to a parlour in the region's bustling capital of Bari to taste some unusual ice cream, before receiving a lesson in the art of pasta shaping

programme.title: Gino's Italian Escape
programme.desc: Gino D'Acampo visits Rome, and wastes no time in sourcing the pancetta and guanciale he needs to rustle up a traditional pasta carbonara in front of the Colosseum. He then heads to Ariccia, a small town on the outskirts of the Italian capital, to sample porchetta - slow-roasted boneless pork stuffed with seasoning and rosemary - before concluding this leg of his culinary journey by cooking a Roman-inspired dish of pan-fried lamb in rosemary and honey sauce with fennel salad

programme.title: Storage Hunters UK
programme.desc: As well as Heavy D, Nat has to deal with some voodoo magic, which all proves too much for her. Thankfully auctioneer Sean Kelly is on hand with an emergency vehicle

programme.title: Storage Hunters UK

programme.desc: Drug Squad Sergeant Gerry and his team receive intel that three individuals are claiming responsibility for a primary school fire, a mission close to Gerry's heart

programme.title: Gino's Italian Escape
programme.desc: Gino D'Acampo returns to his native Campania - the region in which he grew up and where his family still lives. As a chef, he is eager to visit Gragnano - a town famed for its pasta - and during his time touring the area he is given a masterclass in the art of hand-rolling fusilli. He then takes a trip to the picturesque orchards nearby, and picks some succulent red cherries that inspire him to create a tiramisu with a contemporary twist. Before moving on, Gino decides to do something he has never done before - cook for his Italian relatives - so he serves up a dish of salmon in a spicy arrabiata sauce with some of Gragnano's legendary pasta

programme.title: Gino's Italian Escape
programme.desc: Gino D'Acampo visits a bakery in Altamura, Puglia, where he tries to shape one of the town's distinctive loaves, before travelling to Matera, Basilicata, to sample food traditionally eaten by the poor and rustle up an Italian version of beans on toast. Back in Puglia, the chef explores the tourist haven of Alberobello, taking in its fairy-tale atmosphere and demonstrating how to stuff a rustic loaf with salami, piquant cheese and grilled vegetables

programme.title: Gino's Italian Escape
programme.desc: Chef Gino D'Acampo sets off on another tour of his home country, this time exploring the north of Italy. In the first edition he examines the food that has shaped the city of Florence, beginning by tackling the bistecca alla Fiorentina - a thick and juicy steak - before preparing sliced T-bone with a colourful courgette ribbon and goat's cheese salad. He then heads to the town of Prato, sampling a pastry chef's speciality brioche buns with an aromatic, creamy filling, and conjuring up his own dessert of apple poached in red wine with amaretti biscuit cream

programme.title: Gino's Italian Escape
programme.desc: Gino D'Acampo's next stop is Venice, where he takes a trip on a gondola with a countess to find out about a type of Venetian tapas called cicchetti, before creating his own ciabatta-based platter, featuring courgette and fennel with capers, prawns on chilli mayonnaise and breaded cod on lemon mayonnaise. The chef then heads out of the city to the nearby island of Burano, where he participates in a highly unusual method of cooking risotto

programme.title: Great American Railroad Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo stops at Mattoon, Illinois, where he gets a taste of the early life that shaped President Abraham Lincoln, though struggles to split one rail compared with Lincoln's estimated 700 a day. The political pundit then heads to Kentucky, where a bloody conflict proved decisive in victory for Lincoln's Union. Aboard a paddle steamer on the lower Mississippi, Michael hears about the life of former river boat captain Samuel Clemens, better known as Mark Twain, and in Memphis, Tennessee, uncovers the story of a devastating epidemic. In the home of the Blues, Michael joins some Elvis fans at Graceland

programme.title: Travel Man: 48 Hours In

Day two sees them visit the Isle of Capri and play the lottery using la smorfia, a local guide to the meaning of dreams

programme.title: Travel Man: 48 Hours In

Once belonging to his beloved Granny Ethel, Peter hopes metal craftsman Dom can bring the sentimental kitchen curiosity back to life. David Burville takes on the challenge of restoring a Spanish barrel organ known as an organillo. Owner Carolina Urraca is hoping David can breathe new life into the instrument she loved to play when growing up with her grandmother in Spain. Audio specialist tackles the repair of Lorraine McCourt's portable record player from the 1950s. Originally a gift from her father to her mother when they were courting, the precious momento brings back memories of Lorraine's parents dancing to Nat King Cole. programme.desc: Magician David J Marks hosts the third dinner party in Ipswich, and hopes to win over Kerrie Pankhurst after offending her the previous night. programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: DJ Dave James hosts the fourth dinner party from Ipswich and asks his guests to attend dressed as pop stars. Claire Flatt and Nicki Yucel are suspicious about his celebrity connections, and there is trouble when the diners discover Dave obtained help with the cooking

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Speed-dating expert Nicki Yucel hosts the final dinner party in Ipswich, and is determined to cultivate a romantic atmosphere. As the evening progresses, Kerrie Pankhurst reveals her feelings for another diner, before the winner of the 1,000 prize is announced

programme.title: Come Dine with Me

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Beautician Emma Phillips hosts the third dinner party in east Kent. Her main course is described by one diner as a pet on a plate, and Alexandra Austin declares the menu to be rather odd. Meanwhile, Stephen Drew and Wes Leaver enjoy an impromptu beauty treatment together

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Dog-lover Sally Parry hosts the fourth dinner party in east Kent, hoping to impress her guests with a pink-themed night, including posh pink food and table decorations. However, Sally and Emma have a heated argument, Alex misbehaves and Wes falls asleep

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Flamboyant Stephen Drew hosts the final dinner party in east Kent, and has designed a menu that will allow him to spend time entertaining his guests. programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Yvonne and Graham want a holiday bolthole in the Algarve, as close as possible to the harbour and beach, so Ben Hillman lines up five contenders for their budget of 135,000

programme.title: Britain's Best Beach Huts
programme.desc: Jay Blades and Laura Jackson hunt for the most cutting-edge, 21st-century beach hut. Jay discovers the best view from a loo in Lincolnshire before heading to Eastbourne too visit a takeaway cafe within a pair of beach hut binoculars made to move with the sun. Laura tours an eco-friendly beach hut in Wales where recycling is taken to the max and possibly the country's toughest huts that double up as a seawall to hold back the tide in Hampshire

programme.title: Exploring India's Treasures with Bettany Hughes
programme.desc: Part two of two. Bettany travels to Thanjavur, also known at Tanjore, which was once the capital of the Chola empire, one of the longest ruling dynasties in world history. She explores the 10th-century Brihadeeswarar Temple, before taking the Nilgiri Mountain Railway, an outstanding example of an innovative transportation system built through uneven and challenging terrain. Bettany's adventure in the Malabar Coast finishes aboard one of Kerala's famous houseboats

programme.title: Britain's Most Expensive Houses
programme.desc: Sales broker John has a vast family home to sell in the stunning New Forest. Surrounded by a national park and with 26 acres of grounds, including a swimming pool, an orchard and private woodland, this 12-bedroom home built in 1897 has an asking price of 9million. Meanwhile, managing director Guy and Aoife work on one of their smallest properties - an industrial-style one-bedroom pied--terre in Pimlico in central London, which belongs to the chief executive of Brighton Football Club

programme.title: Celebrity Gogglebox
programme.desc: A rolling cast of famous faces, some of Britain's best loved personalities, turn their hand to being the country's most opinionated viewers, sharing their opinions on what they have been watching during the week. programme.title: Sky Coppers
programme.desc: The hunt is on for a man who has assaulted an officer and dragged them along with his car before escaping. Sergeant Keith Bennet and PC Chris Turton search for a motorbike thief hiding in a wood in the dead of night. After reports come in of a man loitering in gardens in Birmingham, the team find out not everything is as it seems

programme.title: 24 Hours in Police Custody
programme.desc: In the conclusion of this two-part documentary, Victoria Breeden is taken into custody, but claims she is not fit to be interviewed, while police search her home for evidence that proves she has attempted to hire someone to murder her husband. Detectives are determined not to have to release her, but DC Louisa Abbott fears she is dealing with the cleverest criminal she has ever encountered

programme.title: George Clarke's Old House, New Home
programme.desc: George visits Manchester to bring an arts and crafts-inspired Edwardian home into the modern day. In London, he meets Flo, a first-time buyer whose flat needs a rejig to make it the sociable space she has always wanted

programme.title: Becoming Elizabeth
programme.desc: Drama following the untold story of Elizabeth I, before she ascended the throne. Henry VIII's death throws a young orphan Elizabeth Tudor into the unpredictable and dangerous English court. As her nine-year-old brother is crowned king and the great families of England and powers of Europe vie for control of the country, she and her siblings become pawns in a dangerous game

programme.title: Jamie's One-Pan Wonders
programme.desc: Jamie Oliver's favourite recipes from the series, including rolled pork belly, risotto and giant spicy meatballs, the easiest chicken pie and a stunning aubergine burger

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: The competition takes place in and around Leeds, where the first host, 38-year-old choir teacher Dionne, serves up a menu that combines European and Caribbean influences and celebrates her family favourites, with a carnival flourish thrown in for good measure

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Finance director Jane hosts the second night in Leeds. Her plan to grab the grand is to treat her guests to a night of fine dining, but she has her work cut out. Drama teacher Denver is already on the back foot with Jane, after taking offence to being called a 'goth' on the first night. Car painter Darren is concerned that Jane's menu of home-made ravioli, pork and panna cotta could win the week, but he's less impressed when it gets to the table. Painter and decorator Billy has noticed a chilling change among some of the other diners and Dionne is just glad her night is out the way so she can enjoy the rest of the week

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Drama teacher and DJ Denver hosts the third dinner party in Leeds, with a Spanish-inspired menu that also includes a prosecco van and stilt walkers on arrival

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: The final night of the contest in Leeds finds Darren planning to put a fancy twist on what seems to be a basic menu. Billy is concerned about the amount of mustard Darren is using in his dishes and mother-of-five Dionne causes a commotion when she offers up a hug to Jane

programme.title: Chateau DIY

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Vicki Fairbrother hosts the first party in East Lancashire, hoping her steak main and banoffee pie dessert will be enough to win her the 1,000 prize. programme.title: Come Dine with Me

programme.desc: Chelsea Symcox hosts the fourth party in East Lancashire. programme.title: Snatched (2017)

programme.title: Britain's Most Expensive Houses
programme.desc: Sales broker Diana tries to convince property developer Kam that she's the right person to sell his 30million mega-home in Mayfair which boasts a swimming pool, a gym, a steam room and a glass lift. Christine enlists the help of fellow sales brokers Tessa and Amy to help close a deal on a Grade I listed Georgian townhouse in Bath and a modern country home just outside Henley. In London, Aoife has secured the listing for a new development of 15 apartments in Bayswater with a combined potential sales value of 65million and Natalie thinks she might have found the first sale

programme.title: Grand Designs
programme.desc: Kevin McCloud meets a master craftsman whose dream is to build a castle in rural Devon made entirely of mud. Kevin McCabe plans to form the huge property out of two vast curved roundhouses - the largest of which is inspired by the natural geometry of a snail shell - connected by glazing and topped with wildflower meadow roofs to mirror the surrounding countryside. However, the project involves mixing and laying a mind-boggling 2,000 tons of cob, all during warm, sunny weather - and the sheer scale of the task soon becomes clear

programme.title: Five Star Kitchen: Britain's Next Great Chef

programme.title: A Place in the Sun

With Martin's brother Arthur coming along to help, Scarlette Douglas finds five options for his 130,000 budget, but are any of them what Martin is looking for?

programme.desc: First of a two-part special taking viewers behind the scenes of a Cambridgeshire police investigation into a woman who is plotting to have her ex-husband killed. programme.desc: Part one of two. Documentary exploring catalogue of errors that occurred in the run-up to the nuclear disaster, examining newly declassified evidence from the KGB archives about the safety of the plant. The programme examines concerns that had been voiced while the nuclear plant was still under construction, but which were ignored by the Soviet leaders

programme.desc: The armchair critics share their opinions on The Masked Dancer, Married at First Sight UK, Nadiya's Everyday Baking, Bad Sisters, This Is MY House, Epic Adventures with Bertie Gregory, and ITV News

programme.desc: A new student enrols in the imposing form of a four-year-old newfador called Ruby. Eight stone of solid dog, Ruby refuses to budge when owners Nichola and Zeal take her for a walk. However, trainers Sean and Kamal soon there's more to Ruby's stubbornness than meets the eye. Six-year-old Maltese Bichon cross Marco arrives with fed up owner Beth in tow. Beth inherited Marco from her late father - and Marco's repaying the favour by ignoring every word Beth says

programme.title: The Dog House
programme.desc: Olympic cyclist Victoria Pendleton visits Woodgreen animal charity, keen to find a dog she can co-parent with her mother. She meets Leilo, but the Rhodesian ridgeback's long-term medical needs require serious consideration. Lovebirds Shai and Orin's try to hit it off with Polo the lurcher, while Zoe the beagle meets the Forristal family

programme.title: Supermarkets Unwrapped
programme.desc: The team take their trolleys down the fruit and veg aisle. Kate Quilton is in Kenya to see how summer vegetables get to British supermarkets in the thick of winter. Jimmy Doherty looks at the measures taken to transport bananas across the UK, John Whaite finds out why supermarket blackberries are so big, Helen Lawal investigates a robot berry-picker in Portugal, and Matt Tebbutt finds out how we can waste less fruit and veg

programme.title: Traffic Cops

programme.title: Traffic Cops
programme.desc: With no ambulances available, officers and an off-duty nurse try to help a young motorcyclist in a serious condition after colliding with a parked truck. A young and desperate driver flees from the police at over 100mph and is left trapped upside down in a smoking car after crashing out of control and rolling his car, while a joyrider takes his mum's car out for a spin wearing just his pyjamas, before losing control and overturning

programme.title: Police Interceptors
programme.desc: Officers follow a stolen BMW fitted with a tracking device as it heads for a cargo ship, while a drunk driver is pursued through Epping Forest. Documentary series profiling the work of a high-speed police interception unit in Essex

programme.title: Police Interceptors
programme.desc: Specially trained officers try to stop a 4x4 as it is driven dangerously through the streets of Basildon, and pursue a fake ambulance. In the air above Essex, the police helicopter trails a pair of teenage car thieves

programme.title: Police Interceptors
programme.desc: The team tracks three men suspected of burgling a number of plumbers' merchants, and a fleeing van causes a major accident by speeding the wrong way around a busy roundabout. Police also investigate illegally customised vehicles in Basildon, Essex, and a man threatens to battle through a street full of officers

programme.title: Dogs Behaving (Very) Badly
programme.desc: After their beloved boxer Beau passed away, Liane got another dog of the same breed, Woody, to mend her son's broken heart. But her plan to fix things has spectacularly backfired - 11-year-old Ben feels bullied by Woody and can't even have his mates over for a kickabout without the dog causing chaos. Can Graeme Hall save the day and reunite a family?

Colin and Justin are also renovating the reception area and want to make it more welcoming with a gift shop, so they visit a local sawmill to find timber shelves made from wood from the surrounding forest

programme.title: Traffic Cops

programme.title: Traffic Cops
programme.desc: In North Yorkshire, police are out in force on a bank holiday weekend, and a high-speed pursuit ensues after a driver fails to stop and drives at a police officer. A biker takes a tumble down a steep embankment after losing control on a bend, somehow miraculously escaping serious injury. Jamie Theakston presents.

programme.desc: Inspector Emma Brookes races 40 miles to prevent a suicidal man throwing himself off a rooftop, while one of her colleagues chases a suspected drug dealer. Elsewhere, the Air Support Unit is called to track a fugitive car thief, and a man is caught with a van full of stolen clothes

programme.title: Cause of Death: The Coroner's Office
programme.desc: Documentary following the work of senior coroner for Lancashire and Darwen Dr James Adeley, who runs a team that works from the moment a body arrives in the mortuary through to the inquest, when the cause of death is determined. In the early hours of the morning, two elderly men are found semi-conscious with head injuries in the middle of a darkened stretch of road in Leyland, Lancashire. Police escalate their transfer to Preston Royal Hospital, but one of the men's conditions worsens and he dies. The surviving man has no memory of events, so it is up to the coroner to establish what happened that night, and determine the cause of death
